blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: So, I read Good Omens a long while ago, and I really loved it, but I’ve never been involved much  (read: at all) with the...
question: So, I read Good Omens a long while ago, and I really loved it, but I’ve never been involved much  (read: at all) with the fandom, but with the show coming out I’ve been getting into it. I just finished reading some of your (so!! good!!) fanfic and i love all the meta I’ve read and everything seems cool. Anyway, I just wanted to say everything seems super cool, though it’s honestly kinda intimidating to try and get into a fandom that’s so established. Anyway just wanted to say your stuff rocks!
answer:
Dear anon, I was as intimidated when I first strolled into this fandom 14 years ago as you are now, so that’s intensely relatable. The only difference now is that I have time, dozens of rereads of the novel, and a body of transformative work to show for it. You have to start somewhere, whether it’s as a consumer who cheers creators on, or as a consumer and creator both. You’ll find your niche, I’m sure, whether it’s fic or art, or fanmixes, or even some kind of community organizing (see under: moderating Good Omens Holiday Exchange or similar). There’s more than enough space for newcomers to figure out how they’d like to contribute, and you will find a place.

(Thank you so much for reading and loving my stories, for loving my development of these characters and my extension of their world as much as you do! For those of us who write, enthusiastic and responsive readers are an honor, and a humbling one.)

trail.content:
Dear anon, I was as intimidated when I first strolled into this fandom 14 years ago as you are now, so that’s intensely relatable. The only difference now is that I have time, dozens of rereads of the novel, and a body of transformative work to show for it. You have to start somewhere, whether it’s as a consumer who cheers creators on, or as a consumer and creator both. You’ll find your niche, I’m sure, whether it’s fic or art, or fanmixes, or even some kind of community organizing (see under: moderating Good Omens Holiday Exchange or similar). There’s more than enough space for newcomers to figure out how they’d like to contribute, and you will find a place.

(Thank you so much for reading and loving my stories, for loving my development of these characters and my extension of their world as much as you do! For those of us who write, enthusiastic and responsive readers are an honor, and a humbling one.)

summary: “The David Bowie song ‘Aladdin Sane’. There is a piano solo in that, by a guy called Mike Garson. If you go to listen to it -...
caption:
“The David Bowie song ‘Aladdin Sane’. There is a piano solo in that, by a guy called Mike Garson. If you go to listen to it - the piano solo is ‘Good Omens’.”

ShowbizJunkies - ‘Good Omens’, Interview with Neil Gaiman, Douglas Mackinnon, NYCC, October 2018 (x)

tags: feel free to add any canon source material if i'm missing anything
summary: uhhh so I want to read good omens but idk if it's just the one book, or a series, or whatever, and Google is bad at this kind of...
question: uhhh so I want to read good omens but idk if it's just the one book, or a series, or whatever, and Google is bad at this kind of question, so i was hoping you (the local good omens gremlin) could help?
answer:
i demand being referred to by ‘the local good omens gremlin’ for the rest of time

anyway - it’s one book! google is saying a bit under 300 pages, so not too bad of a read (i’d double check but my friend has my copy atm). there’s also a small canon thing set in-universe that i think neil and terry both contributed to and neil gaiman occasionally writes excerpts on his tumblr

summary: Hilbert: How long have we been friends? Lovelace: Friends? We’re not friends! We’re on opposite sides! Hilbert: We're on our...
body:
Hilbert: How long have we been friends?
Lovelace: Friends? We’re not friends! We’re on opposite sides!
Hilbert: We're on our side!
Lovelace: We have nothing whatsoever in common! I don’t even like you!
Hilbert: You doooo.

summary:
fun fact: in russian, one of the slang words for 'gay/homosexual' is 'голубой' which means 'light blue'
and obviously the...
body:
fun fact: in russian, one of the slang words for ‘gay/homosexual’ is 'голубой’ which means 'light blue’

and obviously the translators of good omens had to work with that while translating the bit about aziraphale’s gayness

so one of the variants made him 'so light blue that any tropical island would hire him to illuminate the sky in the middle of the touristic season’

reblog.comment:

and obviously the translators of good omens had to work with that while translating the bit about aziraphale’s gayness

so one of the variants made him 'so light blue that any tropical island would hire him to illuminate the sky in the middle of the touristic season’
